verses.verse: Lo, mine eye <WH5869> hath seen <WH7200> all this, mine ear <WH241> hath heard <WH8085> and understood <WH995> it.
What ye know <WH1847>, the same do I know <WH3045> also: I am not inferior <WH5307> unto you.
Surely <WH199> I would speak <WH1696> to the Almighty <WH7706>, and I desire <WH2654> to reason <WH3198> with God <WH410>.
But <WH199> ye are forgers <WH2950> of lies <WH8267>, ye are all physicians <WH7495> of no value <WH457>.
O that <WH5414> ye would altogether <WH2790> hold your peace <WH2790>! and it should be your wisdom <WH2451>.
Hear <WH8085> now my reasoning <WH8433>, and hearken <WH7181> to the pleadings <WH7379> of my lips <WH8193>.
Will ye speak <WH1696> wickedly <WH5766> for God <WH410>? and talk <WH1696> deceitfully <WH7423> for him?
Will ye accept <WH5375> his person <WH6440>? will ye contend <WH7378> for God <WH410>?
Is it good <WH2895> that he should search you out <WH2713>? or as one man <WH582> mocketh <WH2048> another, do ye so mock <WH2048> him?
He will surely <WH3198> reprove <WH3198> you, if ye do secretly <WH5643> accept <WH5375> persons <WH6440>.
Shall not his excellency <WH7613> make you afraid <WH1204>? and his dread <WH6343> fall <WH5307> upon you?
Your remembrances <WH2146> are like <WH4912> unto ashes <WH665>, your bodies <WH1354> to bodies <WH1354> of clay <WH2563>.
Hold your peace <WH2790>, let me alone, that I may speak <WH1696>, and let come <WH5674> on me what will. Hold: Heb. Be silent from me
Wherefore do I take <WH5375> my flesh <WH1320> in my teeth <WH8127>, and put <WH7760> my life <WH5315> in mine hand <WH3709>?
Though <WH2005> he slay <WH6991> me, yet will I trust <WH3176> in him: but I will maintain <WH3198> mine own ways <WH1870> before <WH6440> him. maintain: Heb. prove, or, argue
He also shall be my salvation <WH3444>: for an hypocrite <WH2611> shall not come <WH935> before <WH6440> him.
Hear <WH8085> diligently <WH8085> my speech <WH4405>, and my declaration <WH262> with your ears <WH241>.
Behold now, I have ordered <WH6186> my cause <WH4941>; I know <WH3045> that I shall be justified <WH6663>.
Who is he that will plead <WH7378> with me? for now, if I hold my tongue <WH2790>, I shall give up the ghost <WH1478>.
Only do <WH6213> not two <WH8147> things unto me: then will I not hide <WH5641> myself from thee <WH6440>.
Withdraw <WH7368> thine hand <WH3709> far <WH7368> from me: and let not thy dread <WH367> make me afraid <WH1204>.
Then call <WH7121> thou, and I will answer <WH6030>: or let me speak <WH1696>, and answer <WH7725> thou me.
How many are mine iniquities <WH5771> and sins <WH2403>? make me to know <WH3045> my transgression <WH6588> and my sin <WH2403>.
Wherefore hidest <WH5641> thou thy face <WH6440>, and holdest <WH2803> me for thine enemy <WH341>?
Wilt thou break <WH6206> a leaf <WH5929> driven to and fro <WH5086>? and wilt thou pursue <WH7291> the dry <WH3002> stubble <WH7179>?
For thou writest <WH3789> bitter things <WH4846> against me, and makest me to possess <WH3423> the iniquities <WH5771> of my youth <WH5271>.

Thou puttest <WH7760> my feet <WH7272> also in the stocks <WH5465>, and lookest narrowly <WH8104> unto all my paths <WH734>; thou settest a print <WH2707> upon the heels <WH8328> of my feet <WH7272>. lookest: Heb. observest heels: Heb. roots
And he, as a rotten thing <WH7538>, consumeth <WH1086>, as a garment <WH899> that is moth <WH6211> eaten <WH398>.
